metadata.title: CVE-2018-5092 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when the thread for a Web Workeris freed from memory prematurely instead of from memory in the main threadwhile cancelling fetch operations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
